From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


This article needs to be updated. Please help update this article to reflect recent events or newly available information. (October 2021)
2021 Indian romantic film


SumeruDirected byAvinash DhyaniProduced by
Avinash Dhyani
Ravinder Bhatt
Starring
Avinash Dhyani
Sanskriti Bhatt
Shagufta Ali
CinematographyHarish NegiEdited byMohit KumarMusic bySunjoy BoseProductioncompanyPadmasiddhi FilmsRelease date
1 October 2021 (2021-10-01)
CountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Sumeru is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language film directed by Avinash Dhyani and starring Avinash Dhyani and Sanskriti Bhatt.[1][2][3]  The film was shot at various locations in Uttarakhand.[4] The film is scheduled to be released on 1 October 2021.[5]
The film is an innocent love story between Bhavar Pratap Singh (Dhyani) and Savi Malhotra (Bhatt).[6] Ali will be seen in a "small but important role" in this film.[7]


Cast[edit]
Avinash Dhyani as Bhavar Pratap Singh
Sanskriti Bhatt as Savi Malhotra
Shagufta Ali as Shamaira
References[edit]


^ "Shagufta Ali offered film after she spoke of financial, health issues: 'It is a small role but an important one'". Hindustan Times. 14 August 2021. Retrieved 28 August 2021.

^ "ट्रैकिग-माउंटेनियरिग से जुड़ी प्रेम कहानी है सुमेरू" ['Sumeru' is a love story related to trekking-mountaineering]. Dainik Jagran (in Hindi). 23 August 2021. Retrieved 28 August 2021.

^ "Shagufta Ali Gets Role in Avinash Dhyani's Sumeru After Seeking Financial Help". News18. 14 August 2021. Retrieved 28 August 2021.

^ Kadam, Keetri (24 August 2021). "Shot in picturesque Uttarakhand, 'Sumeru' is ready for release in theatres!". CineBuster Online. Retrieved 28 August 2021.

^ "Musical love story "Sumeru" all set to release in cinema on 1st October 2021". Business Standard. 14 August 2021. Retrieved 28 August 2021.

^ "Musical love story "Sumeru" all set to release in cinema on 1st October 2021". ANI. 14 August 2021. Retrieved 28 August 2021.

^ "After opening up about financial instability Shagufta Ali offered a role in a film". Times of India. 14 August 2021. Retrieved 28 August 2021.
